Class GoofyRobot

java.lang.Object
  GoofyRobot

public class GoofyRobot
extends java.lang.Object

This class connects a software object with a physical robot connected with four bumper sensors.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Donald Duck

Constructor Summary
GoofyRobot(long idNumber)
          Initializes and connects this robot to the physical robot with ID number idNumber
GoofyRobot(long idNumber, int powerLevel)
          Initializes and connects this robot to the physical robot with ID number idNumber

          Checks and returns the powerLevel of this robot.

          Returns a true if the button sensor has been pushed; otherwise, returns false

          Moves the robot backward indefinitely until a stop() or another command is issued.

          Moves the robot forward indefinitely until a stop() or another command is issued.

idNumber - ID number of the physical robot

Method Detail

getPowerLevel

public double getPowerLevel()
Checks and returns the powerLevel of this robot.

Returns:
power level of this robot between 0 and 100, inclusively.

isPressed

public boolean isPressed(int buttonNumber)
Returns a true if the button sensor has been pushed; otherwise, returns false

Parameters:
buttonNumber - Any of the four buttons (0 corresponds to B0, 1 to B1, etc..) on the robot.

moveBackward

public void moveBackward()
Moves the robot backward indefinitely until a stop() or another command is issued.

moveForward

public void moveForward()
Moves the robot forward indefinitely until a stop() or another command is issued.

moveLeft

public void moveLeft()
Moves the robot to the left indefinitely until a stop() or another command is issued.

moveRight

public void moveRight()
Moves the robot to the right indefinitely until a stop() or another command is issued.

stop

public void stop()
Stops the robot if it is moving.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Returns a string representation of this robot. That is, it returns a string of all the moves or commands that have been issued on the robot.
